title: How famous is Indian classical music outside India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Indian classical music is quite popular outside Indian as well. In fact we have a separate wing of ICCR's which is tasked to promote them outside India as well. The primary objective of the Council is to establish, revive and strengthen cultural relations and mutual understanding between India and other countries. In order to promote awareness of India’s composite cultural heritage abroad, the Council has 35 Indian Cultural Centres in different parts of the world. The Cultural Centres function under the administrative control of the Council and the respective Indian Missions abroad. In fact some of the foreigners have dedicated themselves towards it fully and are very talented and popular in Indian classical music instruments. Some of them are : Steve Gorn ( Bamboo Flute or bansuri)  Setsuo Miyashita (Santoor)  Saskia Rao de Hass (Indian Cello)  Gianni Ricchizzi (Vichitra Veena and Sitar) John Higgins (Carnatic Music)  Chong Chiu Sen (Carnatic Classical)

Even when one does not understand the texts in a piece of music, one can still enjoy it. Music does not require words to express. Indian Classical Music is widely accepted in many countries. There are may institutions in foreign nations where the students are taught in gurukul tradition. Countries like USA, UK, Dubai, Australia, Bangladesh (to name a few) organize concerts featuring Indian Classical Music.  Indian Classical Music is quiet popular in foreign nations. And as we see more and more youngsters are attracted towards this form of music not only in India, but outside too.
